cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 380 miles SE of Galveston, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest toward the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the TX-LA border around Sabine Pass/Port Arthur – Lake Charles area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch from Freeport TX to San Luis Pass TX and from the Mouth of the Mississippi River eastward
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning and Storm-Surge Warning from San Luis Pass TX to Intracoastal City LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coastline including Galveston Bay area
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained ≥39 mph) likely Wednesday evening; brief hurricane-force gusts possible if the core jogs west.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–5 ft inundation possible inside Galveston Bay; 6–9 ft just east of the bay entrance (Port Bolivar to Sea Rim State Park).
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches with locally 15 inches possible, producing flash and urban flooding in the Houston metro/port area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes beginning Wednesday evening; dangerous rip currents and heavy surf affecting pilot boarding operations.
